pr_title: Update dependencies to the latest versions

timeline.message: Update dependencies to the latest versions

timeline.bodyText: Was this an API change in jctools?
timeline.author: NiteshKant

replies.bodyText: jctools update was a major version bump (e.g. 2.x -> 3.x) so API breaking is fair. However the package name didn't change so this may result in collisions at runtime and the and maven coordinates didn't change so this may cause trouble for build tools at compile time during the transition period... /cc @nitsanw
replies.author: Scottmitch

replies.bodyText:
yep, they had minor API changes: https://github.com/JCTools/JCTools/blob/master/RELEASE-NOTES.md#300
@Scottmitch @NiteshKant will you suggest to not update for now? Netty 4.1.45 depends on jctools 2.x, the next netty version will use 3.0.0. We can update it later to make it consistent with netty: netty/netty@8410b08
replies.author: idelpivnitskiy

replies.bodyText: however, there were no api changes made in netty, so we should be good either way
replies.author: idelpivnitskiy

replies.bodyText: AFAIR netty shades jctools so we should be fine. Lets update
replies.author: NiteshKant
